You have survived 9 modules.
You can read Cyrillic.
You can introduce yourself.

*   **–í—ñ–Ω/–í–æ–Ω–∞** -> **-—î / -–µ** (Short).
*   **–ú–∏** -> **-—î–º–æ / -–µ–º–æ** (We - Emo).

In Ukraine, we don't use A-F grading in schools anymore.

*   **1-3:** Bad (–ü–æ—á–∞—Ç–∫–æ–≤–∏–π) - *Fail*.

## cultural insight: Kyiv Metro
The Kyiv Metro is fast, cheap, and very deep.
**Arsenalna** station is the deepest in the world (105.5 meters).
You go down... down... down. It takes 5 minutes on the escalator.

How to pay:
*   **Phone/Card:** Just tap at the gate. Modern!
*   **QR Ticket:** Buy at the machine.
*   **Token (–ñ–µ—Ç–æ–Ω):** Historical plastic coin. Almost gone now.

> [!tip] **Metro Etiquette**
> Stand on the right side of the escalator. Walk on the left.
> If you stand on the left, people will be angry.
> Also, give your seat to elderly people (**–ë–∞–±—É—Å—ñ**). It is the law of the jungle.

## cultural insight: Ukrzaliznytsia
**–£–∫—Ä–∑–∞–ª—ñ–∑–Ω–∏—Ü—è** (Ukrainian Railways) is legendary.
Trains are slow but reliable.
You will drink tea in a metal glass holder (**–ü—ñ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–∫–∞–Ω–Ω–∏–∫**). It is iconic.
Usually, people share food sharing (**–î—ñ–ª–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è —ó–∂–µ—é**) on the train. If someone offers you sausage or chicken, take a little bit. It is polite.

>

**Congratulations!**
You have completed the A1.1 Phase (First Contact).
You are no longer a beginner. You are a **Survivor**.
Next Phase: **A1.2 Navigation**.
Get ready for Cases. Get ready for Life.

## cultural insight: Diploma
In Ukraine, graduation is a huge holiday.
We say: **–í—ñ—Ç–∞—é!** (Congratulations!).
And we give flowers. Lots of flowers.
Usually odd numbers (3, 5, 7). Even numbers (2, 4, 6) are for funerals.
**Rule:** Give 3 roses to a living person. Give 2 to a dead one.
Don't mix this up.

In Ukraine, graduation is a huge holiday.
We say: **–í—ñ—Ç–∞—é!** (Congratulations!).

Don't mix this up.
